column4: Hi, I installed ubuntu on /dev/sba, then connected my xp drive, /dev/sda.   My bios is set to boot to grub, how do I add a section to enable grub to boot to XP ?
you mean that ubuntu is now sdb?
yes, sorry, sdb
no, my misunderstanding, you're further along than I read
you can add a stanza to /boot/grub/menu.lst by hand, a sec
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/29057/ that should work for you
thanks, but ubunto is hd(0,0), so surely I'll need something other for xp.
I could have swore you said ubuntu was sdb, but no never mind:  change that to hd(1,0) , and grub> map (hd0) (hd1) grub map (hd1) (hd0)
what do you mean, 'switch shell'?
you can make that permanent with system->admin->users & groups, choose the account and look at the advanced tab
bad joke,
yes, so it's your normal shell instead of bash
boot in the live cd, mount the root file system, and edit /boot/grub/menu.lst . Try removing the   splash   word from the kernel line. Not a pure fix, but might get you past that problem
that's just it, i can't seem to boot the live disk, after selecting the "boot from live cd", it doesn't work.
oh, have you run the check disk on the startup menu yet?
not tried it..never had to, but i may
you've used this disk before, on other installs?
never...
so that may be the case
run the disk check then
i'll try
add   deb http://archive.canonical.com/ubuntu gutsy partner   to your sources.list, sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get  install vmware-server

this works properly:  system->admin->restricted driver , enable ati restricted. reboot. log in, run fglrxinfo and make sure it's using ati 8.37.6 driver. install xserver-xgl compizconfig-settings-manager , then log out and back in. Go to system->prefs->appearance effects tab
